item.description: Lots of exciting things are happening with Data Saturdays and we want you, the #SQLFamily, involved. With the generous donation from Denny Cherry and Associates Consulting, DCAC, we have commissioned 99Designs artists to create a new logo for branding. The Data Saturdays Admins reviewed over 220 submissions these were considered the likeability, accessibility, inclusiveness, and ease of multi-use. item.title: WebSockets over HTTP/2 - Chrome Platform Status
item.description: Supports WebSockets over HTTP/2 in Chromium as specified in RFC 8441 https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc8441. This is only used for secure WebSockets requests, and only when there is already an HTTP/2 connection where the server has already advertised support for WebSockets over HTTP/2 via the HTTP/2 SETTINGS parameter defined in the specification.

item.title: suite - Privacy-Enhancing Cryptography | CSRC | CSRC
item.description: We would like to obtain public feedback on the document 'Toward a PEC use-case suite (Draft)' Abstract: This document motivates the development of a privacy-enhancing cryptography (PEC) use-case suite. This would constitute a set of proofs of concepts, showcasing the use of cryptographic tools for enabling privacy in various applications. This is not a proposal, but rather a sketch idea to motivate initial public feedback, which can be useful to determine a potential process towards a PEC use-case suite. Keywords: cryptography, privacy; privacy-enhancing cryptography (PEC); reference material; secure multiparty computation (SMPC); zero-knowledge proof (ZKP) Call for feedback Privacy-enhancing cryptography (PEC) refers to cryptography used to enhance privacy, beyond the traditional sense of data confidentiality. For example, it enables sophisticated interactions that obtain a useful output of the combined information of multiple entities, although without them sharing their inputs with one another....
